projects.description: This application generates a random quote from the hit TV show 'The Office'. The quote is updated with a new random quote and a new background color when the 'show another quote' button is clicked or it's automatically updated every 10 seconds.

This application is a page of 54 students where a pagination bar displays 10 students at a time on a single page. There is a search bar to update the list in real time, keeping 10 students on the page at a time, and displaying a 'no results' page when no students are matched with the contents of the search bar.

This app is a form for a coding conference. All fields have to be filled out or an error will be thrown, telling you to update the necessary fields. The fields update in real time to ensure the user has everything filled out on the first submit. A text box displays when the 'other' input is selected for the job role and depending on which t-shirt style you choose, it automatically updates the available colors for that style. It will display the payment method that is selected and hide the rest.

When 'start game' button is clicked, a random quote will be generated from an array. The letters of the quote will be hidden and it's up to you to guess the letters without losing all five lives. If all letters have been revealed the game will end and display a congrats message, on the other hand if all lives are lost the game will end and display a losing message.

Makes use of the Random User Generator API (https://randomuser.me/) to grab information for 12 random “employees,” and use that data to build a prototype for an Awesome Startup employee directory. When a person is clicked a detailed card will appear allowing you to move through employees. You can also search for a specific employee in real time with the search bar.
